question.p: How many statisticians does it take to screw in a lightbulb?
In 500 words or less, please explain why Bayesians don't have souls.

Three statisticians, Adam, Betty, and Charlie, go big-game hunting together. After hiking for about an hour, they spot a deer. Adam shoots first, and misses 10 meters to the left. Betty shoots next, and misses 10 meters to the right. Charlie exclaims, "We got 'im!" Do you agree? Explain your reasoning briefly.
